entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: University of Chicago
entry.content: ... that scientists at the University of Chicago achieved a self-sustaining nuclear chain reaction under the stands of a football stadium?

entry.title: James Findley Nolan
entry.content: ... that gynecologist James Findley Nolan delivered babies and, on one occasion, an atomic bomb?

entry.title: two separate fatal aircraft crashes
entry.content: ... that the 2001 Biggin Hill Airshow featured two separate fatal aircraft crashes?

entry.title: Jan Świerc
entry.content: ... that Jan Świerc and eight other Catholic priests murdered at Auschwitz and Dachau were recognized as martyrs by Pope Leo XIV?

entry.title: 12th Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam
entry.content: ... that 70 high-ranking party officials were disciplined under the 12th Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam?

entry.title: Charlie Mitchell
entry.content: ... that Charlie Mitchell's path to Michelin-starred kitchens started in the valet lot?

entry.title: Australian budget estimates
entry.content: ... that a senator once brought fake dynamite into an Australian budget estimates hearing to make a point about parliamentary security arrangements?

entry.title: Waverly W. Wray
entry.content: ... that Waverly W. Wray was a quarter-inch from death?

entry.title: Traum von Monte Carlo
entry.content: ... that Traum von Monte Carlo (pictured) depicts a casino transformed into an allegorical vision of destruction and moral decay?
